channel.title: International: Top News And Analysis
channel.description: CNBC International is the world leader for news on business, technology, China, trade, oil prices, the Middle East and markets.

item.title: Tesla stock soars 22% for best day in over a decade on Musk's 2025 growth projection
item.description: Tesla shares soared 22% Thursday, the stock's best day in 11 years, following its better-than-expected third-quarter earnings.

item.title: Judge blocks Coach owner Tapestry's proposed acquisition of Michael Kors parent Capri
item.description: The FTC sued to block the merger between Tapestry and Capri, arguing it would harm consumers and employees.

item.title: French trader bet over $28 million on Trump election win using 4 Polymarket accounts
item.description: Supporters of Donald Trump, including Elon Musk, have touted shifting election odds on Polymarket even as polls largely show a tight race with Kamala Harris.

item.title: Air taxi firm Lilium's shares plunge 61% after company says main subsidiaries will file for insolvency
item.description: Shares of Lilium tanked Thursday after the air taxi firm said in a filing that its two main subsidiaries plan on filing for insolvency in the coming days.

item.title: U.S. will be ‘more pro-crypto’ after this election, no matter who wins, says Ripple CEO Garlinghouse
item.description: Ripple CEO Brad Garlinghouse is a big cynic on U.S. crypto regulation, but highly optimistic about the post-election environment around the corner.

item.title: Spirit AeroSystems weighs hundreds more furloughs or layoffs if Boeing strike goes beyond Nov. 25
item.description: More than 32,000 Boeing machinists walked off the job on Sept. 13 after turning down an earlier tentative agreement.

item.title: CNBC's Inside India newsletter: A poorly timed IPO?
item.description: Some cite unique elements of the listing as factors in its faltering IPO. Others, however, say sitting on the sidelines means losing out on long-term gains.

item.title: Warren Buffett — worried about impersonators — says he doesn't endorse candidates or investments
item.description: Buffett's actions were triggered in part by a fake political endorsement alerted to him on Meta's Instagram.

item.title: This luxury train ride around the world lasts 59 days, visits 12 countries and costs over $125,000
item.description: 2025 will be the second time high-end travel agent Railbookers will be hosting its "around the world by luxury train" trip.

item.title: Britain announces major change to fiscal rules to free up billions in spending
item.description: U.K. Finance Minister Rachel Reeves on Thursday confirmed she intends to change the country's fiscal rules in the October budget.

item.title: Another European Central Bank member says a jumbo cut is on the table
item.description: The ECB's Mārtiņš Kazāks joined his colleague Mario Centeno in saying a 50-basis-point rate cut should be on the table at the central bank's December meeting.

item.title: Presidential election is a dead heat though Trump leads Harris big on economy, says CNBC survey
item.description: Trump leads Harris 48%-46%, according to the CNBC All-America Economic Survey, within the poll's 3.1% margin of error.

item.title: Nvidia doubles down on India with Hindi language model and major partnerships
item.description: Nvidia on Thursday announced a slew of partnerships with major Indian firms and launched a Hindi language model.

item.title: Barclays shares hit nine-year high after third quarter profit jumps 23%, beating expectations
item.description: British bank Barclays on Thursday reported £1.6 billion ($2 billion) net profit attributable to shareholders for the third quarter, beating expectations.

item.title: Chinese smartphone maker Oppo doubles down on AI, says in regular talks with Google and Microsoft
item.description: As Chinese smartphone company Oppo gears up for a flagship phone launch overseas, it says it has weekly AI talks with Google and Microsoft senior management.

item.title: Nvidia supplier SK Hynix posts record quarterly profit as AI boom drives demand
item.description: Revenue for the third quarter grew about 94% year-on-year.

item.title: A 'tidal wave' of natural gas supply — the biggest yet — will reshape global markets, says RBC Capital
item.description: The expansion is likely to lead to a state of oversupply by the end of 2026, analysts such as RBC's Adnan Dhanani have projected.

item.title: Why the Japanese yen is hovering near three-month lows against the dollar
item.description: The yen hit a low of 153.18 against the greenback, its weakest since July 31.

item.title: Tim Cook is likely visiting China to bolster support for Apple Intelligence, analysts say
item.description: The CEO met with China's Minister of Industry and Information Technology as well as the heads of some local companies, including China Mobile and Weibo.

item.title: Boeing machinists reject new labor contract, extending more than 5-week strike
item.description: Boeing machinists walked off the job on Sept. 13 after overwhelmingly rejecting an earlier proposal.

item.title: Southwest and activist investor Elliott strike deal to keep CEO Bob Jordan, add six new directors
item.description: Southwest Airlines stuck a deal with activist Elliott which staves off a potential proxy fight in exchange for sizable board representation.

item.title: Tesla shares jump on profit beat, Musk's prediction of at least 20% 'vehicle growth' next year
item.description: Tesla reported better-than-expected profit in its third-quarter earnings report on Wednesday.

item.title: CNBC Daily Open: Treasury yields have made a return, like an unwelcome ex
item.description: Like an unwelcome ex-partner who shows up during the most inopportune times and refuses to leave, Treasury yields too have been hogging the market limelight.

item.title: China and Russia's 'profound' ties will not change despite 'turbulent' geopolitical landscape, Xi tells Putin
item.description: Putin called the partnership "one of the main stabilizing factors in the international arena."

item.title: IBM stock slips on disappointing consulting and infrastructure revenue
item.description: IBM's critical software category performed well due to Red Hat's gains, but the consulting and infrastructure segments pulled down overall results.

item.title: Abercrombie & Fitch responds to former CEO's sex trafficking arrest, says it will cooperate with law enforcement
item.description: Abercrombie & Fitch said it will cooperate with law enforcement after its former CEO Mike Jeffries was arrested on sex trafficking and related charges.

item.title: Shares of Peloton surge 11% after David Einhorn says stock is significantly undervalued
item.description: Peloton has been in the middle of a turnaround and Greenlight Capital's David Einhorn thinks the stock is significantly undervalued.

item.title: U.S., China trade tariffs escalating would be 'costly for everybody,' IMF deputy director says
item.description: An escalation of tensions around trade and tariffs would have economic consequences around the world, Gita Gopinath, deputy managing director of the IMF, said.

item.title: 'Time to be a little bit cautious': Norway's $1.8 trillion wealth fund issues stock market warning
item.description: Norges Bank Investment Management (NBIM), one of the world's largest investors, says risks are tilted to the downside for global stock markets.

item.title: UK's ruling Labour Party rejects accusations of U.S. election interference
item.description: The U.K.'s ruling Labour Party has rejected accusations by Donald Trump's campaign team that its party members have interfered in the U.S. election.
